intro: Eschscholzia multicaulis, commonly known as the Sierra California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, bright orange or yellow flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in full sun. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known species like the common poppy. Eschscholzia multicaulis is known for its adaptability and is often found in mountainous regions.
